name: amp2response
description:
Estimate response function coefficients based on the DWI signal in single-fibre voxels.

This command uses the image data from all selected single-fibre voxels concurrently, rather than simply averaging their individual spherical harmonic coefficients. It also ensures that the response function is non-negative, and monotonic (i.e. its amplitude must increase from the fibre direction out to the orthogonal plane).

If multi-shell data are provided, and one or more b-value shells are not explicitly requested, the command will generate a response function for every b-value shell (including b=0 if present).

References:

Smith, R. E.; Dhollander, T. & Connelly, A. Constrained linear least squares estimation of anisotropic response function for spherical deconvolution. ISMRM Workshop on Breaking the Barriers of Diffusion MRI, 23.
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au) and J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com)

inputs.name: mask
inputs.description: the mask containing the voxels from which to estimate the response function

inputs.name: directions
inputs.description: a 4D image containing the estimated fibre directions

inputs.name: response
inputs.description: the output zonal spherical harmonic coefficients

inputs.name: isotropic
inputs.description: estimate an isotropic response function (lmax=0 for all shells)

inputs.name: noconstraint
inputs.description: disable the non-negativity and monotonicity constraints

inputs.name: directions
inputs.description: provide an external text file containing the directions along which the amplitudes are sampled

inputs.name: shells
inputs.description:
specify one or more b-values to use during processing, as a comma-separated list of the desired approximate b-values (b-values are clustered to allow for small deviations). Note that some commands are incompatible with multiple b-values, and will report an error if more than one b-value is provided. 
WARNING: note that, even though the b=0 volumes are never referred to as shells in the literature, they still have to be explicitly included in the list of b-values as provided to the -shell option! Several algorithms which include the b=0 volumes in their computations may otherwise return an undesired result.

inputs.name: lmax
inputs.description: specify the maximum harmonic degree of the response function to estimate (can be a comma-separated list for multi-shell data)

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

output-files.name: response
output-files.description: the output zonal spherical harmonic coefficients
